metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAP device driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big) networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
